alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 2:58PM PDT until August 20 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Apple and El Dorado burn scar in... Riverside County in southern California... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 600 PM PDT. * At 258 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling over the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding in and around the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Redlands, Yucaipa, Forest Falls, Mount San Gorgonio, Beaumont, Banning, Hwy 38 Between Yucaipa And Onyx Summit, Mountain Home Village, Angelus Oaks and Calimesa. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. Debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
